unnormalised: Telecommunications Sector Sees Shift in Data Plan Consumption
normalised: Telecommunications Sector Sees Shift in Data Plan Consumption

unnormalised: New Delhi – A recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) indicates a significant shift in data plan consumption patterns across the country. The average Indian consumer now uses approximately 15 GB of data per month, a figure that has doubled in the last two years, driven by increased smartphone penetration and affordable 4G services.
normalised: New Delhi – A recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) indicates a significant shift in data plan consumption patterns across the country. The average Indian consumer now uses approximately fifteen gigabyte of data per month, a figure that has doubled in the last two years, driven by increased smartphone penetration and affordable four G services.

unnormalised: Jio and Airtel continue to lead the market, with Vodafone Idea struggling to keep pace. The report highlights a growing demand for unlimited data plans, especially among younger users in Tier-II and Tier-III cities. Concerns remain, however, regarding the affordability of these plans for lower-income groups.

unnormalised: Analysts at IIM Ahmedabad predict further data price wars in the coming months. The impact of the upcoming 5G rollout on data plan pricing is yet to be seen, but experts expect a premium for 5G services initially. The reliance on mobile data for entertainment, akin to characters glued to screens in the Bollywood film "3 Idiots," is also contributing to the surge in consumption, according to sociologists. Further details of the report are expected to be released next week. Rs. 500 recharge packs remain popular, but the trend is towards higher denomination plans.
